WorkItem.ClosedComment: No intention of enforcing this across the board.
WorkItem.Description:
Tonight I spoke to another arcane mage, and he told me he prioritizes haste over hit and mastery, and that he doesn't use Rawr. At first, I thought I was speaking with a madman, but I'm now convinced that if there are any sane people on my server, he's all of them, and that it's time to carry the flag of sanity home to the Warsong Lumber Mill of Rawr development.
 
He pointed out that in a lot of situations, such as when the Spark of Rhyolith spawns, maximizing burst damage on a priority target turns out to be more important than maximizing total damage over the entire fight. And in the real world, decent raiders time our cooldowns based on the tactical demands of boss mechanics, not based on the output of sequence reconstruction. This is true of healing and mitigation too -- sustained healing and mitigation are important, but you have to save cooldowns for when they're needed most, or you'll wipe the raid.
 
Why not add a Burst score for damage dealers and healers, based on the amount we can deal in, say, 15 seconds, if we save our cooldowns for some specific point in time? That'll bring the value being optimized a bit closer to what actually matters.
WorkItem.Summary: Burst scores needed for DPS & healers

Comments.Message: As far as mage model goes you can already do this using the boss handler to specify phases with multipliers or more/less important targets. I have no intention of creating a separate score for burst.
Most healing models have a burst rating, and some healing/dps/tank models go off the boss handler, making this somewhat a moot point.
I know I haven't gotten around doing this for DPSDK yet, but there's not alot of change in the burstiness of DK priorities.  Though yeah, TankDK is all suited and plugged fully into the BossHandler.
